metadata.title: CVE-2015-8467 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The samldb_check_user_account_control_acl function indsdb/samdb/ldb_modules/samldb.c in Samba 4.x before 4.1.22, 4.2.x before4.2.7, and 4.3.x before 4.3.3 does not properly check for administrativeprivileges during creation of machine accounts, which allows remoteauthenticated users to bypass intended access restrictions by leveragingthe existence of a domain with both a Samba DC and a Windows DC, a similarissue to CVE-2015-2535.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8467` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
